thread.title: Alabama opens as sizable favorite over Arkansas
thread.title_full: Alabama opens as sizable favorite over Arkansas

author: Matt Zenitz | mzenitz@al.com
title: Alabama opens as sizable favorite over Arkansas
text:
Alabama opens as sizable favorite over Arkansas Alabama Football G06 at Arkansas 2014 Alabama head coach Nick Saban tries to get his team to dig in during the first quarter of the Alabama at Arkansas football game, Saturday, October 11, 2014, at Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium in Fayetteville, Ark. Vasha Hunt/vhunt@al.com ORG XMIT: ALBIN401 (VASHA HUNT) 
Alabama escaped with a 14-13 win at Arkansas last year — only after a Landon Collins interception ended a potential Razorbacks game-winning scoring drive late in the fourth quarter. 
Oddsmakers don't believe this year's game will be that close. 
Alabama is a 16-point favorite heading into next week's game against Arkansas in Tuscaloosa, according to Vegas Insider. 
The Tide (4-1) are back up to No. 8 in the AP poll after beating then-No. 8 Georgia, 38-10, Saturday in Athens. 
The Razorbacks (2-3) have dropped three of their last four games after beginning the season with a 48-13 win over UTEP. 
However, No. 9 Texas A&M needed a late comeback and overtime to beat Arkansas, 28-21, Sept. 26. 
The Razorbacks beat Tennessee, 24-20, Saturday. 
Though Arkansas is without two of its top players — running back Jonathan Williams and wide receiver Keon Hatcher — junior running back Alex Collins has run for 151 yards or more in each of the Razorbacks' last three games. 
Quarterback Brandon Allen — a three-year starter — was 20 of 25 for 225 yards with one touchdown and one interception against Texas A&M.
